com.mindfusion.scheduling.model

Class Schedule

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mindfusion.scheduling.model.Schedule

  • public class Schedule
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a timetable of scheduled events. In the model-view architecture, Schedule instances are the documents whose data is displayed by Calendar instances - the views.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int CurrentVersion
      Current version of schedule file format.

      Adds a ScheduleListener to the schedule.

      Stops recording undo/redo commands into a CompositeCommand and discards the records created so far.

      Clears all items, tasks, locations, contacts and resources contained in this schedule.

    • Method Detail

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Description copied from class: Schedule
        Disposes any resources used by this Schedule object.

        It is important to call Schedule.dispose() on the object when you are done using it, in order to stop the schedule's timer used to trigger reminder events.

      • saveTo

        public void saveTo(java.lang.String fileName,
                   ContentType contentType)
        Description copied from class: Schedule
        Saves the schedule to a file.

        Use loadFrom to restore the data later.

        Parameters:
        fileName - The path of the file to save to.
        contentType - One of the ContentType constants.

      • loadFrom

        public void loadFrom(java.lang.String fileName,
                     ContentType contentType)
        Description copied from class: Schedule
        Loads schedule data from a file.

        This method loads the schedule data from a file where it was previously saved by a call to saveTo. Any data contained in the schedule is discarded before the items stored in the file are loaded.

        Parameters:
        fileName - The name of the file from which to load the schedule.
        contentType - One of the ContentType constants.

      • saveToXml

        public void saveToXml(org.w3c.dom.Document document)
        Description copied from class: Schedule
        Saves the schedule to an XML document.

        Saves the schedule data as tags in an XML document. Use Schedule.loadFromXml(org.w3c.dom.Document) to restore the schedule data later.

        Parameters:
        document - A Document object that allows adding data to the XML document.

      • loadFromXml

        public void loadFromXml(org.w3c.dom.Document document)
        Description copied from class: Schedule
        Loads schedule data from an XML document.

        Loads schedule items from an XML document previously created by Schedule.saveToXml(org.w3c.dom.Document). Any data contained in the schedule is discarded before the items stored in the reader are loaded.

        Parameters:
        document - A Document instance that allows reading data from the XML document.

      • saveToString

        public java.lang.String saveToString(ContentType contentType)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from class: Schedule
        Encodes the schedule into a string.

        Saves the schedule data into a base64-encoded string. Use Schedule.loadFromString(java.lang.String, com.mindfusion.scheduling.model.ContentType) to restore the data later.

        Parameters:
        contentType - One of the ContentType constants.
        Returns:
        A string containing all schedule data.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

        This method loads from a string data previously saved by Schedule.saveToString(com.mindfusion.scheduling.model.ContentType).

        Parameters:

        contentType - One of the ContentType constants.
        Throws:

      • registerItemClass

        public static void registerItemClass(java.lang.Class<? extends Item> itemClass,
                                     java.lang.String classId,
                                     int classVersion)
        Description copied from class: Schedule
        Registers a schedule item class for serialization support.

        When using custom item classes, use this method to enable saving and loading the custom item objects to/from XML files. The class id string is written before each item's data, and when loading items later that string indicates to the schedule what class instance to create and let it load the subsequent data. The following class identifiers are reserved and should not be used: 'std:appointment', 'std:resource', 'std:contact', 'std:location' and 'std:task'.

        The version identifier must be increased when the format in which items are saved changes. It is used when loading files to let your application load items data from an older format.

        Note: All custom item classes must provide a parameterless constructor. Failing to do so would result in exceptions during the load process, since the schedule will be unable to create custom items.

        Parameters:
        itemClass - A Class instance identifying the item class.
        classId - A class identifier to use when saving and loading items of the specified type.
        classVersion - A revision number of the item's class serialization format.

      • registerResourceClass

        public static void registerResourceClass(java.lang.Class<? extends Resource> resourceClass,
                                         java.lang.String classId,
                                         int classVersion)
        Description copied from class: Schedule
        Registers a resource class for serialization support.

        When using custom resource classes, use this method to enable saving and loading the custom resource objects to/from XML files. The class id string is written before each resource's data, and when loading resources later that string indicates to the schedule what class instance to create and let it load the subsequent data. The following class identifiers are reserved and should not be used: 'std:appointment', 'std:resource', 'std:contact', 'std:location' and 'std:task'.

        The version identifier must be increased when the format in which resources are saved changes. It is used when loading files to let your application load resources data from an older format.

        Note: All custom resource classes must provide a parameterless constructor. Failing to do so would result in exceptions during the load process, since the schedule will be unable to create custom resources.

        Parameters:
        resourceClass - A Class instance identifying the resource class.
        classId - A class identifier to use when saving and loading resources
        classVersion - A revision number of the resource's class serialization format.

      • getAllItems

        public ItemList getAllItems(DateTime startTime,
                            DateTime endTime)
        Description copied from class: Schedule
        Retrieves a list of all events, including recurrent item instances, scheduled to occur in the specified time interval.

        If a recurring event occurs in the specified interval, each occurrence is represented by an Item instance whose getRecurrenceState is Occurrence.

        Parameters:
        startTime - Time interval start.
        endTime - Time interval end.
        Returns:
        A list that contains the events scheduled to occur in the specified period.

      • getAllItems

        public ItemList getAllItems(DateTime startDate,
                            DateTime endDate,
                            Contact contact)
        Description copied from class: Schedule
        Retrieves a list of all events, including recurrent item instances, scheduled to occur in the specified time interval for a specific Contact object.

        If a recurring event occurs in the specified interval, each occurrence is represented by an Item instance whose getRecurrenceState is Occurrence.

        Parameters:
        startDate - Specifies the start of the time period.
        endDate - Specifies the end of the time period.
        contact - A Contact instance that must be related to the items.
        Returns:
        A list that contains the events scheduled to occur in the specified period for the specified contact.

      • getFreePeriod

        public DateTime getFreePeriod(DateTime from,
                              DateTime to,
                              Duration duration)
        Description copied from class: Schedule
        Returns the next period after the specified date with the specified duration which is not occupied by items.

        If there are recurring items associated with a resource in the specified list, the function execution might take very long if a period with the specified duration doesn't exist.

        Parameters:
        from - The start date of the interval in which to search for a free period.
        to - The end date of the interval in which to search for a free period.
        duration - The required minimum duration of the period.
        Returns:
        A DateTime object representing the start time of the period found or DateTime.MinValue if none.

      • getFreePeriodByResource

        public DateTime getFreePeriodByResource(DateTime from,
                                        DateTime to,
                                        Duration duration,
                                        ResourceList<Resource> resources)
        Description copied from class: Schedule
        Returns the next period after the specified date with the specified duration, which is not occupied by items associated with the specified resources.

        If there are recurring items associated with a resource in the specified list, the function execution might take very long if a period with the specified duration doesn't exist.

        Parameters:
        from - The start date of the interval in which to search for a free period.
        to - The end date of the interval in which to search for a free period.
        duration - The required minimum duration of the period.
        resources - The resources whose items should be considered when looking for the free period.
        Returns:
        A DateTime object representing the start time of the period found or DateTime.MinValue if none.

        A DateTime object representing the start time of the period found or DateTime.MinValue if none.

      • startCompositeOperation

        public void startCompositeOperation()
        Description copied from class: Schedule
        Starts recording undo/redo commands into a CompositeCommand.

        After the schedule modifications are done, call Schedule.commitCompositeOperation() or Schedule.cancelCompositeOperation().

      • cancelCompositeOperation

        public void cancelCompositeOperation()
        Description copied from class: Schedule
        Stops recording undo/redo commands into a CompositeCommand and discards the records created so far.

        You must call either Schedule.commitCompositeOperation() or this method when the schedule modifications are done after a Schedule.startCompositeOperation() call.

      • commitCompositeOperation

        public void commitCompositeOperation()
        Description copied from class: Schedule
        Stops recording undo/redo commands into a CompositeCommand and saves the composite in the history queue.

        You must call either Schedule.cancelCompositeOperation() or this method when the schedule modifications are done after a Schedule.startCompositeOperation() call.

      • executeCommand

        public void executeCommand(Command command)
        Description copied from class: Schedule
        Executes the specified command on this schedule.

        If undo/redo is enabled, the command is saved in the undo history or added to the active composite command.

        AddItemCommand and RemoveItemCommand objects are created automatically by the control when adding or removing items, both programmatically or interactively. Calling this method explicitly could be necessary in order to save item's state for later undo using a ChangeItemCommand, or to run a custom operation represented by a class derived from Command.

        Parameters:
        command - The Command to execute.

      • undo

        public void undo()
        Description copied from class: Schedule
        Undoes an action saved in the command history.

        The control supports unlimited undo/redo depth. This method moves the "current command" pointer one position back, and calling it again will undo the previous command. The commands can later be redone by calling Schedule.redo().

      • redo

        public void redo()
        Description copied from class: Schedule
        Executes again an action saved in the command history.

        The control supports unlimited undo/redo depth. This method moves the "current command" pointer one position back, and calling it again will undo the previous command. The commands can be undone by calling Schedule.undo().

        Parameters:
        e - An object, containing the event data.

      • getItems

        public ItemList getItems()
        Description copied from class: Schedule
        Gets all scheduled items.

        The Calendar component displays each element of this collection in the time cells corresponding to the item's StartTime and EndTime.

        Returns:
        An instance of the ItemList class containing all items in the schedule.

      • getTasks

        public ResourceList<Task> getTasks()
        Description copied from class: Schedule
        Gets all tasks defined in this Schedule.

        If you need to assign a Task object to schedule items, add the task to this collection before assigning it to the item.

        Returns:
        An instance of the ResourceList class containing references to the tasks assigned to the schedule.

      • getContacts

        Description copied from class: Schedule
        Gets all contacts defined in the Schedule.

        Add contacts to this collection before assigning them to a schedule item.

        Returns:
        An instance of the ResourceList class containing all contacts used in the schedule.

        Description copied from class: Schedule

        Add resources to this collection before assigning them to schedule items.

        Returns:
        An instance of the ResourceList class containing all resources associated with this schedule.

      • getDisableReminders

        public boolean getDisableReminders()
        Description copied from class: Schedule
        Gets a value indicating whether to completely disable reminders in the whole schedule.
        Returns:
        true to disable reminders; false to enable them. The default is false.

      • setDisableReminders

        public void setDisableReminders(boolean value)
        Description copied from class: Schedule
        Sets a value indicating whether to completely disable reminders in the whole schedule.
        Parameters:
        value - true to disable reminders; false to enable them. The default is false.

        Returns:
        A positive integer value specifying the time between subsequent reminder checks.

      • setRemindersCheckInterval

        public void setRemindersCheckInterval(int value)
        Description copied from class: Schedule
        Sets the interval between reminder checks, expressed in seconds.
        Parameters:
        value - A positive integer value specifying the time between subsequent reminder checks.

      • getUndoEnabled

        public boolean getUndoEnabled()
        Description copied from class: Schedule
        Gets a value indicating whether saving action records for later undo is enabled.

        To undo the last recorded action, call the Schedule.undo() method. It can be redone again by calling Schedule.redo(). Custom operations can be integrated into the undo/redo system by deriving from the Command class and running the operations by means of the Schedule.executeCommand(com.mindfusion.scheduling.model.Command) method.

        Returns:
        true, to save actions for later undo; otherwise, false. The default is false.

      • setUndoEnabled

        public void setUndoEnabled(boolean value)
        Description copied from class: Schedule
        Sets a value indicating whether saving action records for later undo is enabled.

        To undo the last recorded action, call the Schedule.undo() method. It can be redone again by calling Schedule.redo(). Custom operations can be integrated into the undo/redo system by deriving from the Command class and running the operations by means of the Schedule.executeCommand(com.mindfusion.scheduling.model.Command) method.

        Parameters:
        value - true, to save actions for later undo; otherwise, false. The default is false.

      • getCanUndo

        public boolean getCanUndo()
        Description copied from class: Schedule
        Gets a value indicating whether there is a command in the undo history which can be undone.
        Returns:
        true, if the undo queue contains operations that can be undone; otherwise, false.

      • getCanRedo

        public boolean getCanRedo()
        Description copied from class: Schedule
        Gets a value indicating whether there is a command in the redo history which can be redone.
        Returns:
        true, if the undo queue contains operations that can be undone; otherwise, false.
